intro: Labichea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf labichea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
